What will be the output of the following ABAP code, If the values of p_num1 and p_num2 are 25 and 4 respectively?

REPORT z_abap_5.
PARAMETERS:
  p_num1 TYPE i,
  p_num2 TYPE i.

START-OF-SELECTION.
 DATA vl_num_str TYPE string.
 DATA vl_num_len TYPE i.
 DATA vl_num1_str TYPE string.
 vl_num_str = p_num1.
 CONDENSE vl_num_string NO-GAPS.
 vl_num_len = strlen( vl_num_str ).
 IF vl_num_len > p_num2.

  WRITE: vl_num_str(p_num2).
 ELSE.
  DATA vl_z TYPE i.
  DATA vl_lz TYPE string.
  vl_z = p_num2 - vl_num_len.

  DO vl_z TIMES.
   CONCATENATE vl_lz '0' INTO vl_lz.
  ENDDO.
  CONCATENATE vl_lz vl_num_str INTO vl_num1_str.
  WRITE: vl_num1_str.
 ENDIF.

What is the output of the following ABAP code snippet?

REPORT z_abap_1.
DATA: c_num TYPE i VALUE 1,c_count TYPE i VALUE 0.
START-OF-SELECTION.
WHILE c_num <= 100.
IF (c_num MOD 2 ) = 0 AND (c_num MOD 5 ) = 0.
ADD 1 TO c_count.
ENDIF.
ADD 1 TO c_num.
ENDWHILE.
WRITE c_count.

q:
What is the output of the following ABAP code?

​
REPORT  Z_ABAP_1.

DATA: num_a TYPE i VALUE 0, num_b TYPE i VALUE 0.

WHILE num_a < 10.
  num_a = num_a + 1.
  IF num_a BETWEEN 5 AND 7.
    CONTINUE.
  ENDIF.
  num_b = num_b + num_a.
ENDWHILE. 
WRITE num_b.
​
